response:
Investigations should confirm optic nerve involvement, look for demyelinating lesions or alternative structural causes, and screen for inflammatory, autoimmune, infectious, vascular, hereditary, and nutritional aetiologies to guide acute and long-term management.

investigations = ["MRI of brain, orbits and cervical spine with gadolinium and fat-suppressed sequences", "Ophthalmology assessment with dilated fundus examination", "Automated visual field testing (e.g., Humphrey perimetry)", "Optical coherence tomography of retinal nerve fibre layer and macula", "Visual evoked potentials", "Lumbar puncture with CSF cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands and IgG index", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "Serum vitamin B12 level", "Serum folate level", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme level", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies", "Serum aquaporin-4 IgG antibodies", "Serum MOG-IgG antibodies", "Syphilis serology (e.g., TPHA/VDRL)", "HIV serology", "Serum lipid profile", "Genetic testing for Leber hereditary optic neuropathy (if clinical suspicion persists)", "Temporal artery ultrasound or biopsy (only if clinical features suggest giant cell arteritis)"]
